items.title: The Art of Applying: Coach & Editor for Grad School Admissions Bootcamp
items.content:
Coach & Editor for Grad School Admissions Bootcamp

Posted Feb 3

The Art of Applying
Headquarters: New York, NY (formerly Austin, TX)
http://theartofapplying.com/teach

Write, Teach, Edit, Encourage, and Coach Grad School Applicants to Success


Position: Full-Time Instructor & Coach for The Art of Applying's Application Accelerator program (full-time remote employment)

Compensation: $50,000-$70,000 + bonuses for achieving outstanding client results 

Note: Compensation is comprised of $36,000 base pay + variable pay based on number of clients you work directly with as their primary instructor. Bonuses for achieving outstanding client results are in addition to figures listed above.

The $50,000 figure is the approximate pay for working with 5 new clients per month; the $70,000 figure is the approximate pay for working with 10 new clients per month. Because graduate admissions is very seasonal, the workload varies throughout the year with 5 being on the low side of new clients per month.

Vacation: 10 paid vacation days 

Work hours: Monday - Friday 10 am - 7 pm Eastern with a one-hour unpaid lunch (there is room for some flexibility with the hours, but these are primarily the required hours)

Location: Remote (must be located in the United States or Canada)

Deadline to apply: Thursday, February 8, 2018 at 11:00 pm Eastern

Start Date: Thursday, March 1, 2018 at the very latest

The Art of Applying is a fast-growing education company founded by a woman Harvard MBA & MPA graduate that helps people from all over the world get admitted to their dream graduate schools with funding to pay for it.

We’re looking for an enthusiastic, reliable, encouraging, outgoing graduate degree holder with excellent communication skills, outstanding essay and resume editing skills, and a love for storytelling, teaching and learning to join our 100% remote team (yes, you’d get to work from home!) as the first Full-Time Faculty Member for our Application Accelerator, a bootcamp for high-achieving high-potential applicants to Ivy League MBA, MPP, JD, M.Ed., MSW, Engineering, Data Science, and Design programs.

As the full-time instructor, you will serve as the primary coach and point person for a caseload of 5-10 new clients per month who are applying to their dream schools and scholarships. You will teach and reinforce the tested system and curriculum our founder has created, review submitted homework of your clients, hold online office hours, edit your clients' materials, and support your clients to success in getting into their dream schools with substantial scholarship funding.

Right now, our goal is to hire two outstanding full-time instructors and to add more instructors as needed.

How would you like to be with a company that helps people get into their dream graduate schools with funding that is at the very beginning of a significant growth phase?

A company that is willing and able to thoroughly train you, give you the curriculum to teach, and show you everything you need to know to succeed?

A company that is more concerned about your passion and potential than about your job history or your experience?

A company that has twice-yearly all expenses paid company retreats? Our last retreat was in Austin, Texas and included beating a difficult Escape Game, a dessert reception with some of our clients, touring the city, one-hour massages, and eating the world’s best BBQ. Yeehaw!

With hard work and a willingness to learn, you will have the opportunity to build your skills, contribute to an amazing mission, have fun with like-minded people, and do it all while working from home.

Requirements:

  • Masters degree or PhD—the more prestigious the school the better
  • experience teaching, coaching, and/or tutoring in a 1-on-1 and group environment
  • excellent communication skills
  • outstanding editing skills
  • strong writing skills
  • engaging, encouraging teaching style
  • ability to keep client information strictly confidential
  • comfortable with technology; willing to learn how to use Zoom, Basecamp, Helpscout, Gmail, Google Sheets, and Google Docs
  • available to work 40 hours per week

Primary job duties:

  • meet weekly with CEO to update her on client progress
  • hold weekly office hours for 2-3 consecutive hours for clients to live edit client materials and have clients come and ask you questions about their application process
  • hold monthly office hours for 2-3 consecutive hours for clients who have graduated from the bootcamp but still have lingering questions or concerns
  • edit approximately 20k - 50k words of multiple drafts of essays, resumes, and other application content for each client you work with (editing happens over multiple months and is intense around MBA deadlines in August, November, and December).
  • conduct 1-on-1 coaching calls with clients and keep notes on coaching calls
  • conduct mock interviews with clients to help them prepare for admissions interviews
  • answer client questions about their application process via the client portal system
  • propose ideas to CEO on how to improve the experience for our clients
  • propose, create, and teach additional modules for the bootcamp curriculum
  • write blog posts about graduate admissions and highlighting client success stories

Who we aren’t looking for:
  • people afraid of technology or who are proud to be “not computer savvy”
  • people interested in a remote role so they can travel several months out of the year
  • people who want to start their own business or build their own brand
  • people looking to make quick cash on the side. We're building a long-term team as we scale, and want people who are interested in building a career here.

Apply for this position

http://theartofapplying.com/teach

items.title: Legalcom: Editor of Content
items.content:
Editor of Content

Posted Jan 30

Legalcom
Headquarters: EU/US
https://legalcom.group

We’re looking for a reliable, talented editor who loves creating high-quality content.

We work with a remote team of freelance writers in dozens of countries all over the world and we are looking for an editor to review, edit and manage our content:

  • Review and edit articles written by our freelance writers. Work with writers to achieve high-quality articles.
  • Propose topic ideas
  • Manage the editorial calendar
  • And so on

About The Work

The work entails:

  • Manage freelancers writers, starting from replying to their job applications to bringing them on board.
  • Propose article topics for writers to write about based on collaboration with SEO manager.
  • Write blog posts and marketing copy to promote our products and services
  • Proofread, re-structure and edit articles by content writers
  • Update our website and social media pages with new content
  • Craft and send our monthly newsletter
  • Interview industry professionals and use online sources to research topics
  • Improve illustration in collaboration with marketing and design teams
  • Optimize published pieces using SEO guidelines
  • Manage the editorial calendar and ensure timely publication
  • Generate new ideas around industry-related topics 

Job Requirements

  • Native English speaker with strong writing skills. We can make an exception on this if you have an English Proficiency qualification.
  • Exceptional online research skills
  • Well organized & rock steady reliable
  • SEO knowledge

It’s a major plus if you have any of the following skills:

  • Legal degree or paralegal experience
  • Some degree of technical proficiency: working knowledge of HTML and WordPress.

How Do We Work?

We work remotely. We generally don’t need to sync time zones. The tools we use to collaborate are:

  • Gmail
  • Google Suite
  • Basecamp

How to Apply

Please send an email to office@legalcom.group with:

- A 4-5 sentence introduction explaining why you think you would be a good fit.
- 3 URLs showcasing your work related to internet laws or technology.
- Your desired monthly pay or hourly rate. We’ll work on a 2-weeks to a 1-month trial period at first.

Please format your subject line as follows: Your Name | Editor of Content | WeWorkRemotely (example: John Doe | Editor of Content | WeWorkRemotely)

Apply for this position

Please see above "How to Apply".

items.title: Wildbit: Content Strategist/Copywriter
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere or Philadelphia, PA)

We’re looking for a content strategist to really help us improve and formalize our approach to content strategy and help make it a more consistent part of our process. We’re not pefrect, and we could really use help with our content strategy, editorial, and copyrighting. We have a deep appreciation for content, and we’re ready to do more than just wing it. Can you help?

Be the champion for content on a growing team

Do you get excited thinking about establishing tone and voice guidelines for products and teams? Does writing and editing blog posts and guides to help customers sound like fun? Do you enjoy writing marketing copy and crafting the story for landing pages? Are you interested in helping define the editorial process for a growing team? Do you love writing and editing technical content aimed at developers?

Focus on helping customers succeed

At Wildbit, content is all about helping our customers succeed. Our marketing and customer success team work hand-in-hand to make that happen. In some cases, that means educating customers about new industry technology or standards, and in others, it’s simply about teaching them the ins and outs of our products. We’re always looking for ways to improve how we share information with customers. 

Be incredibly comfortable with technology and communicating with developers

Since virtually all of our customers are developers, it’s critical that all of our content focuses on the needs and interests of developers. Generally speaking, that means we’re laser-focused on substance over filler or fluff.  We’re mindful of quantitative things like metrics and SEO, but we don’t believe that should drive our content strategy. It can play a role informing the strategy, but it’s not our guiding light.

Do a little bit of everything as we grow

A typical day could involve writing or editing content for the blog or our newsletter. Or you might review analytics or SEO tools to see what we’re doing right (or wrong). Maybe you’ll be producing a new blog post in our CMS (Craft) or planning our upcoming month’s editorial and social media content promotion. Or maybe you’re heads down crafting that just-right marketing copy for an upcoming feature announcement. You could even help us improve our journey towards more video content.

Be a part of a team with a healthy and supportive approach to work

If you love words and have a passion for using technology to communicate, we’d love to talk. Wildbit is remote-friendly and family-friendly with quarterly profit sharing and yearly team retreats to great locations. If you’re in Philly, we even have chef-prepared family-style lunches at the office every day. It may sound corny and difficult to believe, but we really do operate like a family and do our best to support each other and help each other grow in a healthy team environment.

Wildbit is an equal opportunity employer and proud of it.

We’re committed to building a diverse team, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. At our core we believe deeply in diversity, inclusiveness, and acceptance as all being key parts of a healthy team.

Job Perks: Chef-prepared family lunches in Philly office, Full health benefits, Company-paid retreats, Computer setup of your choice, 25 paid days off per year, Quarterly Profit sharing, Attend conferences, Quiet Fridays, 40 hour work week

This is a unique opportunity to join a founding team and impact every renter in the UK through exciting and highly rewarding work

With Generation Rent just around the corner we expect more people renting than ever before. That’s why we believes renting should be more affordable, accessible and rely less on the Mum-and-Dad’s bank. We are a young and innovative startup company solving an affordability problem by offering deposit-free renting to millions of Tenants across the UK - with lots more exciting stuff to come.

We have built a core team and a product we are proud of, partnered with industry leaders, raised significant start capital and are now moments away from launching with the UK largest independent letting agent.

*ROLE DESCRIPTION*
A unique opportunity to join a young start-up company and shape the future of its marketing communication, tone of voice and the language style used across all mediums. This is a part-time job with the potential to becoming a full-time.

*RESPONSIBILITIES*
* Create the company communication style and tone of voice
* Standardise ways of addressing business questions and marketing related explanations
* Proof read all company material and ensure correct use of english and adherence to TOV
* Manage all social footprint of the company (Linkedin, Twitter, Facebook, G+, Instagram, Blog...etc)
* Produce text for applications across competitions and other events
* Create newsletters and other marketing communications
* Create app copy and platform emails
* Create text for internal decks and presentations
* Create copy for drip email campaigns

*QUALITIES*
* Graduate degree from an english speaking university
* Experience in writing corporate copy and communication material Must be native English speaker (or excellent English speaker)
* Enthusiasm and self drive to do what’s needed with limited guidance
* Exceptional communication skills
* Exceptional organisational skills and attention to detail

We offer the following benefits to all flatfair employees (not to mention, awesome work environment, inspiring colleagues and a ton of fun).
* Stock options
* Competitive salary reviewed every 6 months
* Flexible working hours
* 25 paid holiday days
* Free lunch + Snacks!
* Private health insurance
* Workplace pension scheme
* Weekly socials events
* Choose your own equipment

items.title: SiteGround: English Content Writer - Remote
items.content:
English Content Writer - Remote

Posted Dec 6

SiteGround
Headquarters: Sofia, Bulgaria
https://www.siteground.com/careers

About You

You love the written word, it’s an artform to you that allows you to explain how technical products solve people's problems. You’re the person who corrects others’ grammar and spelling, because grammar and spelling are really important (people who don’t think that need their head read). You’re sensitive about the Oxford comma?
 
You’ve also got some experience with websites, which could be as simple as setting up your own WordPress blog or as advanced as doing some PHP development in your own time.

You want to work remotely and you’re looking for the perfect job that doesn’t restrict you to one place.

If you’ve been nodding your head to all of the above, read on.

About Us

We’re a team of technical, service and marketing experts who believe in helping customers leverage technology to get better results for their business. Our main service is web hosting, and we’re really good at it. So good, in fact, we’re one of the only 3 web hosts worldwide recommended by WordPress.org.

SiteGround was founded in Bulgaria in 2004 and sell to clients all over the world. Today we have 5 offices between Bulgaria and Spain, five data centers on 3 continents and host over 800 0000 domains. Due to our continuous growth we are are looking for writers and content experts to build our content team.

The Role

Working for the brand manager, you’ll be helping craft content for different market segments, speaking their language and clearly communicating what they need to know to help them run their online business or hobby better.

You’ll be writing articles, producing ebooks, and refining social media posts on a daily basis.

Requirements

The most important thing is you share our values of Craftsmanship, Quality, Passion, and a sense of Fun. You’ll have to demonstrate each of these in your application.

You have 2+ years of experience writing content, and have the examples to prove it along with stats to show reach and engagement with the target audience.

Benefits

  • Work anywhere in the world, as long as you have 4 hours overlap with Eastern Europe office hours (GMT+3);
  • Permanent contract;
  • Young and friendly team of professionals;
  • Informal and fun working culture;
  • Macbook workstation;
  • Annual Remote Team Building.

If you are interested, please send to jobs@siteground.com your CV and a piece of content explaining why you are the ideal person. We get lots of applications for these types of roles, so make sure you stand out.

Please note: Due to the volume of applications only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further steps.

Apply for this position

Send to jobs@siteground.com your CV and a piece of content explaining why you are the ideal person.

items.title: Content, Community, Social and Marketing, and more
items.content:
Content, Community, Social and Marketing, and more at Around.io

Bengaluru, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
₹400K–₹700K
No Equity

Job Description

I am looking for someone who understands (online) community management, understands basics of inbound marketing, can handle social media, and who can may be write.

Its an amazing opportunity to be face of the company in front of thousands of small businesses across the world.

Lets break it down:

- If you know basics of all the things above and are willing to learn, I am interested in talking to you

- I (& rest of marketing team) will be there every step of the way to help out

- I can assure great learning, and awesome work environment

- We are startup friendly startup, which means, later on if you wish to move on or want to start your own, I will be more than happy to help

- If you want to know what early stage startups goes through on a regular basis, this is THE place to be, we are breaking things (features on website), shipping code daily and living on sine wave (not sure what this means? Contact me :) )

- I believe in taking risks and running experiments, so if you come up with ridiculous ideas (on face of them), I am always ready to test them

- Data is the only truth that we live by, or I should say we try to live by, no opinion (mine or anyone else’s) is bigger than what data says

- Just to make it clear, I do not see this role as a part time role or temporary role, I see this as integral part of my CORE team and intend to keep it that way

If you like to work with artists, crafters, online sellers, merchants, and like to see them succeed, this is a place where you can learn a lot and enjoy at the same time.

I am happy to answer any questions you might have..
